Home.title: Welcome to Embrace Our World Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Embrace Our World Orthodontics, you are more than just a patient — you are family. With over 70 years of combined experience, our family-run practice has cared for generations across the St. Louis area. Our doctors and staff work together to provide an enjoyable orthodontic experience and the life-long smile you deserve. Contact our St. Louis office today to schedule an appointment for you or a family member.

items.title: Family-run Practice
items.text: A family-operated practice with more than 70 years of combined experience serving multiple generations across St. Louis.

items.title: Specialist Doctors
items.text: Board-level orthodontic training and decades of specialist experience provide consistent, expert care for every patient.

items.title: Modern Options
items.text: We offer comfortable, age‑appropriate care including Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and traditional braces to suit teens and adults.

paragraphs.text: Gary H. Shanker, DDS, MS earned a Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Washington University in 1964, his Doctorate of Dental Surgery from the University of Tennessee in 1968, and completed post-doctoral orthodontic training at Washington University in 1972. Dr. Shanker has taught clinical orthodontics as an assistant professor at Washington University and has presented lectures to orthodontists, residents, and dental study groups.

Jonathan A. Shanker, DDS, MS graduated Magna Cum Laude from Boston University in 1996, earned his Doctorate of Dental Surgery from the University of Missouri–Kansas City in 2000, and completed a three-year residency in orthodontics and dentofacial orthopedics at the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, receiving his Master of Science in 2003. Dr. Jonathan brings years of specialized orthodontic training to patient care.

Brian A. Schlueter, DMD, MS earned a Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Texas Christian University in 1997, received his Doctor of Dental Medicine from Southern Illinois University School of Dental Medicine in 2001, completed an Advanced Education in General Dentistry residency, served in the U.S. Air Force Dental Corps, and finished his orthodontic residency with a Master of Science at Saint Louis University in 2006. Dr. Schlueter combines clinical experience and specialty training to provide thoughtful orthodontic care.
We offer a full range of orthodontic options, from removable clear aligners to traditional fixed appliances and early interceptive care for children.

image.alt: Invisalign clear aligners offered at Embrace Our World Orthodontics
Traditional braces options at Embrace Our World Orthodontics

testimonials.author: Mark
testimonials.testimonial: "Drs. Shanker, Shanker, and Schluetter are the best! This is our third patient and the results have been great. The entire process has been so easy and the doctors and staff provide clear communication the entire time. Everyone is so helpful and accommodating, you feel like family. The outcomes for all three have been perfect. Thank you, EOW!"

testimonials.author: Karen P.
testimonials.testimonial: "They are perfectionists! My teen has beautiful teeth now. It took longer than was expected, but there was no extra charge for the additional appointments. Also, my friend got her teeth done there in the 90s. She still has her perfect smile. I recommend them to anyone that wants a beautiful smile."

testimonials.author: Anna Marie
testimonials.testimonial: "We loved the entire experience with Embrace Our World Orthodontics! The team that worked with us over the years expertly evaluated and offered the best solution for her perfect smile. We couldn't be happier with the results. She hasn't stopped smiling, even with her mask on!"

image.alt: Orthodontic team consulting with a smiling patient in a bright modern office

paragraphs.text: For most people, achieving a healthy, beautiful smile is the reason for receiving orthodontic care. If you feel self-conscious about your smile, correcting those concerns with braces or aligners can improve the way you look and feel.

When your treatment is complete, you should have the smile you’ve always wanted and the confidence to show it off. We work to make each step comfortable and clear so you feel supported throughout the process.
Our vision is to provide a fun, positive environment focused on the highest-quality orthodontic care, delivered with personalized attention so every patient feels welcomed and heard.

At Embrace Our World Orthodontics, you are more than just a patient — you are family. Our doctors and staff work together to provide an enjoyable orthodontic experience and the life-long smile you deserve.

Gary H. Shanker, DDS, MS is a practicing orthodontist with a long history of clinical and academic work. After completing his post-doctoral orthodontic training in 1972, he taught clinical orthodontics as an assistant professor at Washington University and has presented lectures to orthodontists, graduate students, and dental study groups.

image.alt: Dr. Gary H. Shanker smiling in his office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Shanker earned a Bachelor of Arts in Biology from Washington University in 1964, completed his Doctor of Dental Surgery at the University of Tennessee in 1968, and finished his post-doctoral orthodontic training at Washington University in 1972.

Dr. Shanker has built a career balancing clinical excellence with teaching. Patients describe him as steady, thoughtful, and focused on long-term outcomes — qualities he brings to every treatment plan.

image.alt: Dr. Gary H. Shanker in treatment room

paragraphs.text: Credentials: Gary H. Shanker, DDS, MS — Post-doctoral orthodontics, Washington University (1972); DDS, University of Tennessee (1968); BA Biology, Washington University (1964).
Visit the full doctor profile: /meet-dr-gary-shanker/
Office: St. Louis office. For details and scheduling, visit /meet-dr-gary-shanker/.
Jonathan A. Shanker, DDS, MS delivers compassionate, evidence-based orthodontic care. He completed advanced specialty training and combines clinical skill with a patient-first approach.

Dr. Jonathan Shanker graduated Magna Cum Laude from Boston University in 1996 (BA Psychology), earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery from the University of Missouri‑Kansas City School of Dentistry in 2000, and completed a three‑year residency in orthodontics and dentofacial orthopedics with a Master of Science degree in 2003 from the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey.
Outside of the clinic, Dr. Shanker focuses on building strong relationships with patients and families, helping them understand treatment options and feel confident about their care.
Credentials: Jonathan A. Shanker, DDS, MS — DDS, University of Missouri‑Kansas City (2000); MS, University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey (2003); BA, Boston University (1996).
Visit the full doctor profile: /meet-dr-jonathan-shanker/
Brian A. Schlueter, DMD, MS provides patient-centered orthodontic care that blends clinical experience with a practical approach to long-term oral health.

Dr. Schlueter earned a BA in Biology from Texas Christian University (1997), received his Doctor of Dental Medicine from Southern Illinois University School of Dental Medicine in 2001, completed Advanced Education in General Dentistry residency training, served three years with the United States Air Force Dental Corps, and completed post-graduate orthodontic training with a Master of Science in Dentistry from Saint Louis University in 2006.

Following service in the Air Force and advanced specialty training, Dr. Schlueter focuses on creating durable, healthy smiles and enjoys guiding patients through clear, understandable treatment plans.

Credentials: Brian A. Schlueter, DMD, MS — DMD, Southern Illinois University (2001); MS in Dentistry and post-graduate orthodontic training, Saint Louis University (2006); BA Biology, Texas Christian University (1997).
Visit the full doctor profile: /meet-dr-brian-a-schlueter/
Office: St. Louis office. For details and scheduling, visit the doctor profile pages.

paragraphs.text: At Embrace Our World Orthodontics, you are more than just a patient — you are family. With decades of combined experience across our team, we take pride in serving the St. Louis community and building relationships that extend beyond the treatment chair.
Our doctors and staff participate in local events and community initiatives when possible, and we focus on delivering care that helps patients of all ages achieve healthy, lasting smiles.

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit begins with a thorough new-patient exam and consultation. We take diagnostic records, review your medical history, and discuss treatment options so you understand next steps and timing.

We use a digital iTero scanner for impressions, which creates a 3D model in just two to three minutes and avoids traditional trays and putty. Watch a short demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2_omrBvyYIQ
We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for your convenience.
Flexible payment plans are available, and our treatment coordinator will review options to find a plan that fits your budget.

Please complete your health-history paperwork before your appointment so we can provide safe, personalized care. We did not locate an online intake link or downloadable PDF in the files provided; if you prefer, bring completed paper forms to your visit or ask our front desk for upload instructions. Note: our forms and contact pages include standard privacy and reCAPTCHA notices.

seo.page_title: Get Started | Embrace Our World Orthodontics
seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic journey with Embrace Our World Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, complete new-patient forms, and schedule your consultation.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, forms, iTero, Embrace Our World Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Embrace Our World Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Embrace Our World Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, complete new-patient forms, and schedule your consultation.

image.alt: Child receiving an early orthodontic evaluation in a bright clinic

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a reliable choice for many patients. Made from high‑grade stainless steel, they use brackets and archwires to apply gentle, continuous force and guide teeth into place.

Metal brackets are bonded to the teeth and connected by wires. Over time your orthodontist adjusts the wires to move teeth predictably. Today’s materials are more comfortable and discreet than older systems.

image.alt: Close-up of traditional metal braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces use tooth‑colored materials to blend with your smile. They offer a more discreet look and are a popular option for older teens and adults who want effective treatment with improved aesthetics.

image.alt: Close-up of clear ceramic braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners to move teeth gradually. Aligners are virtually invisible and can make brushing, flossing, and eating easier during treatment.
Advanced 3D scanning and treatment planning help create a customized plan that maps each stage of tooth movement for predictable results.

image.alt: Clear Invisalign aligner held beside a smiling patient

paragraphs.text: We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup> options for growing smiles. The clear, removable design is discreet and helps kids and teens keep up with school, sports, and oral hygiene.

image.alt: Promotional image for Invisalign for kids showing aligner illustration

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers hold teeth in their new positions. We offer removable and fixed retainers and provide clear instructions to protect your results.
Ask about Vivera® retainers, which are custom‑made using the same digital technology as Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and can help maintain your smile long term.
A palatal expander widens the upper jaw by applying gentle pressure to the molars. It can create space for crowded teeth and help improve bite relationships when used at the right age.

image.alt: Palatal expander appliance shown in a clinical setting

paragraphs.text: The Herbst® appliance helps correct overbites by encouraging forward growth of the lower jaw and guiding the upper molars backward. It is typically used in younger patients while growth is still occurring.

image.alt: Herbst appliance demonstrated on a model

paragraphs.text: The Forsus fatigue‑resistant device is an alternative to headgear. It helps correct certain bite problems by applying gentle pressure to encourage jaw and tooth movement, often reducing the need for more invasive approaches.

image.alt: Forsus appliance placed in the mouth to correct bite

paragraphs.text: Find clear, practical answers to common questions about orthodontic care so you can choose the right treatment, understand costs, and prepare for appointments.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer traditional metal braces, tooth-colored ceramic braces, removable appliances, and clear aligner therapy, including Invisalign<sup>®</sup>. After active treatment we provide custom retainers to protect your new smile.

image.alt: Happy family portrait with smiling patients

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends a screening by age 7. Early evaluations let us catch developing concerns and, when needed, start simpler treatments that can reduce the need for more complex care later.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment length depends on the issue and the chosen method. Many patients complete treatment in 12 to 24 months, though we’ll give a personalized timeline after your initial exam and records.

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We work with many dental insurance plans and offer flexible monthly payment options to make care manageable. Our team will review your benefits and outline out-of-pocket costs before treatment begins.

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: You can book a consultation online using our appointment portal or visit the Contact page to send a request. For same-day concerns we recommend using the online scheduler for the fastest response.

image.alt: Mother and daughter smiling together in reception

accordion.header: How should I care for braces and aligners?

paragraphs.text: For braces, brush thoroughly after meals and avoid hard or sticky foods. For clear aligners, wear them as directed, clean them daily, and remove them only to eat and brush. Follow our team’s instructions to keep treatment on track.
